Detailed Description

Author: Jaakko Luttinen ProjectileBouncing is a class for projectiles that have bouncing ability. They have a parameter to indicate how many jumps they should do before destruction. They also have an elasticity of collisions.

Parameters:

price Price of the projectile.
spriteIndex Index of the sprite.
soundIndex Index of the firing sound.
explosionIndex Index of the explosion type.
radius Radius of the projectile.
mass Mass of the projectile.
damage Maximum damage of the projectile.
damageRadius Radius of the damage.
bounceCount Number of jumps to take before destruction.
elasticity Percentage (0-1) of remaining energy.

Member Function Documentation

void ProjectileBouncing::collide (  BodyProjectile &  capsel,
Body &  collidingBody
)  [virtual]
 

Simulates the collision between the capsule and colliding body. That is, if jumps are left it will bounce, otherwise it will destruct.

Parameters:
capsule The capsule.
collidingBody The body to collide with.

Reimplemented from Projectile.

virtual Projectile* ProjectileBouncing::getCopy (   )  const [inline, virtual]
 

Returns a dynamic copy. Makes it possible to get a copy without knowing which subclass the object actually represents. Every subclass must overwrite this function.

Returns:
Dynamic copy of itself.

Reimplemented from Projectile.

Member Data Documentation

const int ProjectileBouncing::maximumBounces = 10 [static]
 

Number of maximum bounces the projectile can take. We don't want it to jump forever (if lifetime isn't concerned).
